intro: Chamaesaracha coniodes, commonly known as the small-leaf starwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in a spherical shape. It is often found in coastal and inland regions, showing some adaptability to different soil types.
